fields.description:
h3. Summary

Enabling the "Plan permission check" beta feature in 2.12.0 causes uncommitted issues created in a scenario to be incorrectly excluded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable the "Plan permission check" beta feature;
# Create an issue in a Portfolio plan, and don't commit it back to Jira;
# Reload the plan.

h3. Expected Results

The uncommitted created issue is still visible in the plan.

h3. Actual Results

The uncommitted created issue has been filtered out of the plan, and is not visible.

h3.Workaround

# Commit all created issues before reloading the plan;
# Disable the "Plan permission check" beta feature.
fields.summary: "Plan permission check" beta feature incorrectly excludes uncommitted issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if there is issue have dependencies to the other issues, example:
* issue A block by issue B

If issue B has been move to the next sprint, then issue A will not be able to complete, therefore it will required to move issue A manually to the next sprint

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better there is some sort of automation which will move issue A along to the next sprint as well
fields.summary: automation moving item to next sprint based on dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently under Plan configurations for *Unestimated item scheduling* when the option *Base on default estimates* is selected this applies to:
{quote}
Default estimates will be applied to all unestimated childless items across all hierarchy levels
{quote}

Including Issues that are already done but viewable in the Plan that were completed without an estimate set but that would never happen because the issues are currently Done.  The average values just help to mask a problem where the teams are not estimating and gives a false report on how many Story points the team did historically especially in the case of when you filter to to see what the teams did in the past.

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not add an estimate to an issue that is complete when using the *Base on default estimates* option
fields.summary: Base on default estimates adds estimates to completed issues

fields.description: As a user, I have multiple plans that look at the same Jira projects (just different filters into the project).  I am able to create a cross-project release in a single plan, but cannot make it available in other plans.  But, Jira already has the releases actually in it.
fields.summary: Cross-Project Releases across Plans

fields.description:
h4. Summary
If I select a cross-project release to filter my scope or schedule in a Program results in no issues found.  If I selected each of the releases that were part of the cross-project filter, then I got the correct results.  This problem only happens in when looking at a Program, not a Plan.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Cross Project Release (in this example, named *CPR2*)
# Create a Program
# Under Release (filter section), choose Cross Project Release: CPR2

h4. Expected Result
Those epics/initiative associated with CPR2 will be retrieved/listed

h4. Actual Result
It shows no issues
!noissuecpr.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
Choose *CPR2* that is listed under project specific release
!cpr.png|thumbnail!
(i) When you create a new cross-project release, a new project-specific release is created per project with the same details. This is the release that user can choose on program to show associated Epics/initiatives.
fields.summary: Filter by cross-project releases in a Program results in no issues found

fields.description:
Today if we try to Sort by Parent Link, we get the below error in JQL:

"_Field 'Parent Link' does not support sorting._"

It will be needed to be able to sort on the Parent Link by ASC or DESC Summary, similar to what is today available for the field "Epic Link".
fields.summary: Allow sorting by Parent Link

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Updating portfolio custom fields in plan does not update issue's updated date.
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the plan
 # Set value to Portfolio custom fields (such as Target Start, Target End, Team) for issues in the plan
 # Go to those issues

h4. Expected Result

Issues will get updated (_updated_ date field is updated) and updated event is not triggered.
h4. Actual Result

Issues does not get updated (_updated_ date field is not updated), Updated event is not being triggered, and indexing is not triggered.
fields.summary: Updating portfolio custom fields in plan does not trigger indexing (does not update issue's updated date and does not trigger updated issue event)

fields.description:
h4. Problem 

When filtering issues by Team, then certain parent issues are missing.

The bug is limited to versions 2.11 and 2.12

The bug may affect any plan with more than 3 levels in the hierarchy.
fields.summary: Parent aware search is broken due to mutable sets

fields.description:
We'd be very grateful. :) We would like to dig deeper into details in this view.

Ultimately we're bringing together multiple teams who didn't necessarily have visibility like this before. We really do need issue level granularity at a cross plan level if we want to use Programs.
fields.summary: View levels lower than 'Epic' on Program View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA does not allow me to add an extra JQL condition in addtion to the data sources. This makes it especially difficult to limit the plan to 5000 issues.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add another option in addition to all the data sources: The user can specify a JQL expression that limits the filters in the data sources. So to exclude all issues from all data sources that were closed more than one year ago, the user could provide the expression "Closed > -365d". Next to the option should be a display of the number of issues currently in scope, allowing the user to play with the expression to get the right number of issues.

 !image.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Add this expression to the filters of all the data sources.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to specify a JQL expression to limit the issues in the scope of a Portfolio plan

fields.description: When scheduling based on target dates and calculating the plan, issues without a target end date will clear the scheduled start date and in turn clear the target start date when setting targets from calculated. We have all issues being created with a target start date and this is causing us to lose all the dates.
fields.summary: When scheduling based on target dates and calculating the plan, issues without a target end date will clear the scheduled start date and in turn clear the target start date when setting targets from calculated

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, when loading a portfolio plan, it will load/downloading the jira-issue-collector-plugin from JAC (and this request often takes longer time)

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to disable loading issue collector from JAC if the users do not need it.
fields.summary: Having the option to disable loading issue collector from JAC

fields.description:
We often have teams with specializations that prevent one person from working on any item of work. For instance a hardware person that can't pick up a software task. Portfolio is reassigning these work items to load balance and its making the scheduling prediction almost pointless as 2/3 of the available work items in this case are being transferred to the wrong people.

It would be helpful if Portfolio had a way to only do that for tasks that were not assigned to a person and if a task were assigned to a person it would remain with them.
fields.summary: Disable task re-assignment

fields.description:
We try to use 1 plan per release train.  This plan can have 10-14 teams on it each with velocity in points.

It would be nice to aggregate those velocities into a "Plan" velocity.

[http://www.scaledagileframework.com/agile-release-train/]
fields.summary: Aggregate Velocity Per Plan

fields.description:
When showing capacity in the release report, if the plan estimation unit is in days, the reported numbers are in hours instead of days.

Works as expected for hours and story points.
fields.summary: Release report shows capacity in hours instead of days

fields.description:
Currently Portfolio schedules as much as possible for a team member without trying to spread the work which could result in some people being at full capacity and some no work at all.

To preserve both behavior it would be nice to have a scheduling option to allow spreading the work evenly across team members.
fields.summary: Add a calculation setting to spread capacity evenly

fields.description:
Currently, any changes made to the relative portfolio hierarchy ranking will not be brought over to the agile boards properly. It will be great if we can have a consistent issue rank reordering across Portfolio and Jira Software.
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#191970|bgColor=#D9E9FF}
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a Jira Software project e.g. Sandbox (SAN).
# Create a new issue type - call it 'Initiatives' and add to project SAN under the via the *issue type scheme* configuration page.
# Place 'Initiatives' above 'Epic' in the *Portfolio Hierarchy Configuration* page via *General Configuration* > *Add-ons*.
# Create 3 Initiatives, 3 Epic and 3 issue under each Epic.
# Each Epic is tied to one Initiative. Please find a simple representation of the hierarchy.
{code}
• Initiative A
     • Epic A
          • Issue A1
          • Issue A2
          • Issue A3
• Initiative B
     • Epic B
          • Issue B1
          • Issue B2
          • Issue B3
• Initiative C
     • Epic C
          • Issue C1
          • Issue C2
          • Issue C3
{code}
# Create a Portfolio plan based on project SAN.
# In the Portfolio plan, change the filter to 'Initiative'.
# Under the *Scope* view, reorder the ranking of Initiative from top to bottom and from bottom to top.
# Observe the ranking of the issues under the backlog view.
{panel}
fields.summary: Relative ranking on Portfolio hierarchy is not preserved in agile boards

fields.description:
Currently, the ranking of the issues on Portfolio is solely based on the default global rank value. Ranking change on Portfolio does not have any effect on board which issues order by custom global rank field. It will be great if we can add agile board which rank is order by a custom global rank field as Portfolio's data source.
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#191970|bgColor=#D9E9FF}
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a Jira project e.g. Sandbox (SAN).
# Create 5-10 issues in project SAN.
# Create two filters - call them 'Filter Original' and 'Filter Custom'.
# Modify 'Filter Original' with the following JQL query.
{code}project = SAN ORDER BY Rank ASC{code}
# Create a new 'Global Rank' custom field via *General Configuration* > *Issue* > *Custom Field* and call it 'Custom Rank'.
# Modify 'Filter Custom' with the following JQL query.
{code}project = AWE ORDER BY "Custom Rank" ASC{code}
# Create two Scrum boards associated with the two filters created earlier e.g.  'Filter Original' and 'Filter Custom'.
# Create a Portfolio plan based on the Scrum board associated with 'Filter Custom'.
# Reorder the rank and observe the rank change on both Scrum boards.
{panel}
fields.summary: Rank issues based on custom global rank field within Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Problem Scenario

The lucene querying code used to populate the backlog / scope table goes to lucene multiple times. The logic is similar to an enrichment—we make one query to get the initial set of results, then some number of refined queries recursively after that to make sure we resolve all parent links.

The refining filters applied when we recurse should be such that we don't end up with the same issue twice (so repeating the second pass should ultimately return different results, which is fine)—but we still end up making all the same sub-queries again for each repetition of the first part (which isn't fine). 

This results in a not-insignificant and completely redundant amount of processing (to compare and filter the document ids), GC (since the sub-query results are kept in a large expensive hash map), and IO (from hitting the lucene indices on disk).
h3. Suggestion

We can prevent the repetition of these queries by holding on to the state of the QueryExplainer between recursive queries, and reusing the results it already has if we've passed over a sub-query before.

The QueryExplainer is an internal detail of the lower-level IssueLuceneQuerist component, and shouldn't be present in the component making the recursive calls, so we should wrap it in a generic context object that gets passed as an argument in each recursive pass.
fields.summary: JPO plan loading performance improvement: Retain query explainer context over recursive queries
Description for "Dependent story constraint" option is vague in Portfolio documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Planned Capacity is incorrectly calculated in Releases Report when estimation is in Days

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check the *working hours* specified in Jira. By default this would be 8h. 
# In the Portfolio plan, check the "Planning unit". This should be in *Days*
# For a issue in the plan, specify an estimation. Example: 10d
# Create a team with a capacity (80 weekly/h)
# Create a release (1 sprint = 3 weeks)
# Go to the Reports and look for the "Releases" report

h3. Expected Results

The "Planned Capacity" should show up correctly in Days. Eg: in our example for 10d, it should show "10 days"

h3. Actual Results
It shows up in hours with the Days mentioned in the end Eg: 80 Days (10d x 8h=80h)
 !incorrect_planned_capacity.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Planned Capacity is incorrectly calculated in Releases Report when estimation is in Days

fields.description: When Portfolio schedules stories, it sometimes doesn't use the capacity available in the Sprint. e.g. I've seen it only put 1 story of 2 story points into a Sprint. When this happens it should be possible for the user to move other stories into the Sprint themselves from the timeline view.
fields.summary: Allow the user the option to drag and drop stories around in the target schedule to reschedule

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Certain customer configuration does not allow unassigned issues in their JIRA instance.

Currently Portfolio for Jira calculates the issues as if this Team<team name> assignee is a real person.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be best if we can implement a mechanism to calculate issues assigned to a specific named user account as if it is unassigned.

h3. Customer justification
{quote}
AS A user of Portfolio for Jira 
I WOULD LIKE TO to be able to register certain accounts within Portfolio for Jira as 'placeholder accounts' 
SO THAT work assigned to a placeholder account is treated as if it is unassigned.
{quote}
fields.summary: Option to treat specific named user accounts as if the work is unassigned

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Epic rank in JPO lost after adding a Story in JIRA.

+Steps to reproduce+

# Connect JPO to Jira and create a plan
# Add some Epics in JPO to the plan
# Add Epic "Important" to the same plan and rank it to top
# Switch to connected Jira
# Create a Story in Jira and connect it to Epic "Important"
# Switch to JPO and hit refresh

This is expected behaviour since  Portfolio goes bottom up. How important is an epic is defined by how important is its most important children; Or just what's on top gets done first.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Epic to retain the initial Rank set when it's moved to a specific position in Plan even after Story is added to the Epic.


h3. Workaround 

Drag and drop the Epic in Plan view again and commit the change to allow Portfolio to show prefered Rank.
fields.summary: Issue Hierarchy Ranking with Epic

fields.description:
Hello Amazing Atlassian Portfolio Project Team, our suggestion is that you include a "Snapshot" feature that will allow us to take a picture of our schedules projects in the timeline at any given time so that we can review from time to time how things have changed. This will be especially useful for explaining visually to our "line of business" owners throughout the year how our timeline changed and what projects caused those changed to occur.

 

thanks for all you do to make Portfolio "Amazing". ☺
fields.summary: Snapshots

fields.description: It would be good to have the option to allow customers to be able to see some portfolio road map (without spending JIRA paid license for them).
fields.summary: Provide some way to allow unlicensed users to view the Road map in Portfolio

fields.description:
New feature request - ability to add, remove and adjust team members availability over time on Portfolio plans.

For example:

 
||Team member||Capacity||Effective from||Effective to||
|Joe Bloggs|40h|1 Jan|31 Jan|
|Joe Bloggs|20h|1 Feb|28 Feb|
fields.summary: New feature request - Ability to change team member capacity over time

fields.description: Whilst you can custom add and remove columns from the view, a really useful additional feature would be to amend the ordering by drag and drop.
fields.summary: Ability to re-arrange column order in the scope panel in the scope view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, for stories - when we create stories, we set the epic-link in a second step, so any post functions that triggered before the epic link is set might fail if you are using the Epic link value for something else. The reason for this two-step process is that we use the Jira Core API to create the issue, and then we use the Jira Software API to set the epic link.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enhance this feature so that the Epic link gets created in the first step by using JIRA Core API.

h3. Note
This works fine if we create the issue from Create button from JIRA menu bar.
fields.summary: Issue creation from Portfolio plan does not create the Epic Link on the first step

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Portfolio documentation on [Releases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/releases-802170559.html] does not exactly specify that Portfolio for JIRA can only consider one release/version associated with an issue.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to specify it in the documentation, to set the right expectation on the behavior for Portfolio (which is different than how JIRA treats version's associated with an issue)
fields.summary: Documentation improvement on Releases

fields.description: The *Assignees* are not properly displayed after clicking Calculate in a Portfolio program. Refreshing the program *after* the Calculate + auto-refresh takes place in order to get assignees to render.
fields.summary: Assignee is not populated automatically after a program calculation

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior
Only users with "Shared Team Management" are able to edit a shared team, or share a presently private team.

h3. Actual Behavior
Any user with access to a plan in which any team is added can modify that team - regardless of it being shared or private - or share a private team.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create any team and add it to a plan accessible by any user;
# Access the plan as a user without "Shared Team Management" permission;

h3. Workaround
There is no known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: BUG: Manage shared team is allowed even if "Shared Team Management" permission is not granted

fields.description:
As a user, i would like a helper to determine why an issue does not appear in my plan, so that I can make necessary changes to get it into my plan as necessary.

Examples I have run across so far, as been a release excluded from plan, or filtered out, etc.  I would like something to tell me why.  This is similar to the "Permission Helper" function in JIRA.
fields.summary: Helper to determine why issue is not in the plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users would like to assign issues to Sprints by dragging and dropping in Plan view similar to how it's done in other third party plugin:

* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OV3GZOsjELM&t=1s


h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce function in Scope view which allows users to drag and drop issue to preferred Sprint.


h3. Workaround 

Manually add issues to the Sprint either from Board or editing issue & recalculate the Plan.
fields.summary: Allow issues to be dragged and dropped in Plan view

fields.description:
h2. Current Behavior
The tool tip information displayed within the Portfolio Program can be confusing at times - it takes the earliest start date and the latest end date available within the program. As a result, it does not match the information provided on the respective plan's timeline. Please see screenshot below for more information.

 !Mismatched-Timeline.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Standardize the Program Tool Tip Timeline Schedule

fields.description:
The releases are automatically calculated for the Initiative and Epic or higher levels issue types based on their associated work items. When I review the Initiative or Epic in JIRA, no fix versions are assigned. The system should update the Fix Version field to display the associated release(s) as they're displayed in Portfolio. 

!image-2018-01-05-15-23-01-567.png!

 

!image-2018-01-05-15-24-21-564.png!
fields.summary: Initiative & Epic: Releases do not Populate in the Fix Version Field in JIRA Detail View

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, a user can only manually select one version/release for an issue. As a result, the issue will only appear in schedule view for one release.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to allow portfolio user to manually select more than one versions/releases, just like JIRA
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to manually select more than one versions/releases for an issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment Portfolio does not schedule sub-tasks. The sub-task can influence the scheduling algorithm, but ultimately it would schedule at the story level.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have an option to allow user who wants to be able to schedule at sub-task level
fields.summary: As a user, I would like Portfolio to schedule at sub-task level

fields.description:
h3. Environment
JIRA 7.6.1
Portfolio 2.10.0
Internet Explorer 11
Portfolio plan with 1000+ issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a project
Import 1000 issues into project. 
Create a Portfolio plan and set the project as the source for scoped issues.

h3. Expected Results
Scrolling through issues in the plan would be smooth

h3. Actual Results
Scrolling through issues is delayed, as if the browser is slow to respond to user input. This behavior makes it very difficult to browse issues.
 
h3. Notes
This was reproduced in a clean 7.6.1 with no custom fields, complex issue filters, or Marketplace add-ons.
On the client, IE11 begins consuming 50-90% CPU when the page loads.
Browsing through the same plan in Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Edge, and Safari do not exhibit the same.
Issue was reproducible in JIRA 7.3.1,7.4.0, 7.4.4 and 7.6.1

h3.Workaround
Enabling the "Faster responsiveness of scope tables" beta feature slightly improves the scroll lag.
Use one of the browsers mentioned previously.
fields.summary: Browser is slow to respond when scrolling through issues in a large Portfolio plan using IE11.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if the sprints option is enabled in the Epic view, epics that span several sprints are broken into sprint-sized segments, usually on different rows in the sprints. When a segment is selected, the duration is shown for that segment only, not for the entire epic. This can be confusing to users.

h3. Suggested Solution

We would like to see a different visualization, similar to the visualization when the sprints option is not enabled. That is, we would like to see each epic as a bar in the same row spanning multiple sprints. It would be ideal if the sprint-segments in which there are no stories scheduled were visually indicated, perhaps by color or by a gap in the bar. Just as in the Epic view, when the sprints option is not enabled, the displayed duration of the selected epic is the real duration.

This visualization should be an additional option, so users can choose which visualization they prefer.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the Portfolio Scheduler to provide an option for a "non-segmented" visualization of epics when the sprints option is enabled.

fields.description:
The hierarchy view in portfolio is extremely useful but unfortunately, we can't see the entire title of the Jira issue even when we hover over the issue.

Is there a way to add this ability?

Thanks,

 

Kamila
fields.summary: Need the ability to view the entire title of Jira issues in scope dashboard

fields.description:
Hi,

We use Porffolia for our planning. After each meeting, we capture the screen to we have the history of the changes. What would be useful is the ability to copy and paste the list of Jira issues in the dashboard that way, we could preserve the issue links.

This is a very basic thing but it is so important. Without it, it is so painful to keep track of the changes in a useful format

Thanks,

Kamila
fields.summary: Need the ability to copy the list of Jira issues

fields.description:
It would be great to filter by parent issue in a Portfolio Plan, like the filters for Team, Project, etc that already do exist.

In JQL, we can use _issuekey in childIssuesOf("IN-116")_ since -JPOSERVER-1897-, but in the plan and in the program it would also be helpful to reduce the scope-view to all the children of out parent-links (IN-116) to focus on all the todos in for that Initiative.
fields.summary: Filter by parent in Portfolio
PMKVY 2.0

fields.description: During a period of heavy corporate planning, we'll have a mix of projects that ONLY have target start and end dates and others that have actual estimated tasks that provide calculated/scheduled dates. For presentation purposes, it would be helpful to be able to hide the schedule-derived bars and only display the target-derived bars.
fields.summary: Allow Target Schedule view without Schedule impact

fields.description:
h2. Problem
The dependency report does not list dependencies of a certain issue link type, even though it is properly configured in Portfolio's _Dependency Settings_

This happens for dependencies that are swapped, i.e., the dependency type description reads
bq. If A <something> B, then B is scheduled before A

and not _...then A is scheduled before B_

These dependencies are still properly respected by the scheduling algorithm and also show up in the issue details page and schedule tooltip but they are missing in the dependency report.

h2. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Dependency report does not show swapped dependencies

fields.description:
Why is it only possible to select shared teams for the team field in Jira?

We cannot use shared teams on our instance (~10k User) , that would be a total chaos, so every PO / Project maintaines their private teams in Portfolio, which would be totally fine.

But these Teams cannot be selected in Jira :(

Although the user has the rights. Why is this different to e.g. the field "Parent Link"?

The message is

"Plan-specific teams can only be selected through a Portfolio plan"
fields.summary: Plan-specific Teams also selectable from Jira

fields.description: It's desired to have the ability to see which teams are assigned to various issue types in the scope section of a Program's view. Ideally, this would be an allowed column in the Scope section. It's understood that you can filter based on teams, but you should be able to get a gestalt view of the team membership as well, even when you are/aren't filtering for them.
fields.summary: Team column for the Program Scope view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there exists documentation which discusses Portfolio's capabilities for automatically suggesting and assigning Releases, Teams, and Members to backlog items without these values set. The documentation is here: [Releases, teams and member assignments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/releases-teams-and-member-assignments-715262710.html] 

However, this documentation is confusing due to the header note:

{quote}This page refers to Portfolio classic plans. If you are currently running Portfolio 2.0, please check [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-team-settings-802170547.html] to access the latest page version.{quote}

The link takes the user to [Configuring team settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-team-settings-802170547.html], which does not discuss Portfolio's automatic suggestion/assignment logic at all.

h3. Suggested Solution

As the logic discussed in [Releases, teams and member assignments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/releases-teams-and-member-assignments-715262710.html] is still relevant and existent in existing Portfolio versions. Either:
* Remove the header suggesting the user view [Configuring team settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-team-settings-802170547.html] instead of the initial document
* Add the same information from the initial document to [Configuring team settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-team-settings-802170547.html]

h3. Why this is important
 
Due to the suggestion that [Releases, teams and member assignments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/releases-teams-and-member-assignments-715262710.html] is superseded by [Configuring team settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-team-settings-802170547.html], users may not realize that the logic discussed in the initial document is still relevant. They may stop reading it and follow the link to the suggested document, where they will not find the information they're looking for.
fields.summary: Documentation Clarification on automatic Release, Team, and Member assignments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Per [Releases, teams and member assignments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/releases-teams-and-member-assignments-715262710.html], Portfolio will automatically assign backlog items suggested releases and teams/members, as long as there are defined estimates, teams, and releases.

{quote}Once you have defined estimates, your teams and releases, you'll see that backlog items will automatically be assigned to suggested releases and teams/members. 

Everything that is assigned automatically, is depicted by a blue highlighting in the table: 

...

The automatic assignment of releases is based on the priority ranking of the backlog and the available capacities. Items are only assigned dynamically into releases if a release has a fixed end date. In this case, the scheduling algorithm tries to fit in as many high-priority items as possible into the release, until the target release date is reached.{quote}

However, there is no option to disable the automatic assignment of suggested releases and team/members. Organizations with business/technical requirements who do not want this feature are unable to turn this off, and are forced to use the feature.

h3. Suggested Solution

# Allow for automatic assignment of releases and team/members to be a setting that may be toggled on and off, at the plan level.
# Allow for automatically assigned issues in the Timeline to be visually identified (with alternative colors, highlighting, or general appearance), to make it clear which issues in the timeline were not originally part of that release.

h3. Why this is important
 
There exist usage cases where the automatic assignment of releases and teams/members would be undesirable. 

In one specific example, the users would prefer if the issues were not automatically assigned, so that they did not get placed on the Timeline. This would allow for visual identification of how much spare margin there is left for teams to finish their work on their given release. Otherwise, teams cannot easily tell whether issues on the Timeline were originally assigned to their release, or if Portfolio has assigned the release for them.

h3. Workaround 

For a board containing issues which are not assigned a release, create a _shadow_ board identical in configuration, but filter for only issues assigned to a release. This shadow board will not contain issues which do not have a release. 

Create your portfolio plan based on this shadow board rather than the original board. This plan will not see the problem issues and will not be able to assign them the suggested releases, which will prevent them from appearing on the Timeline.
fields.summary: Configure whether to automatically assign release to issues without fix version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time, admins are not able to verify if a plan is still in use.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a way for admins to check if a plan is still being accessed by users.

h3. Why this is important

This will allow admins to clean up unused plans from the instance.
fields.summary: Track Portfolio plan usage

fields.description:
If 'Parent Link' field is updated then the Issue Updated event is generated, users get an email, and listeners can see the change, but when the field is cleared, i.e. empty value is set, then no event is generated, and listeners do no see the change.

Listeners (especially those provided by Scriptrunner) must be able to see the change when Parent Link is removed.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Set a Parent link value in an issue
# Check issue history tab to see the changes to Parent Link field being reflected there
# Search with a JQL like {{"Parent Link" = '<Issue Key>'}} and see that the issue can be searched correctly
# Now remove the value of Parent link on the issue
# Navigate to the history tab to see the changes to Parent Link field *NOT* being reflected there. There is no entry in there for this action.
# Try to search for the issue using {{"Parent Link" is EMPTY}}. The issue is not searchable


h2. Expected behaviour
Parent Link field should behave like any other custom field and log any changes made to the value of the Parent link field.
fields.summary: clearing Parent Link custom field does not generate Issue Updated event

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when exporting a scope report to CSV, it's not possible to choose which fields are selected and all fields are exported. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow user to choose which fields to export or mirror fields selected in the report. 

h3. Why this is important

The description field in particular can be large and makes it difficult to the view the report when exported. 

h3. Workaround 
Delete the Description column (or other undesired columns) manually.
fields.summary: Add option to configure fields exported when exporting Scope Report to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When there is no change to the Parent link or Team field (new value is same as old value), the issue history is still tracking this information like a value change with every single change to any other issue field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in Jira with Parent link and Team fields showing up on issue view and edit screens
# Set the Parent link value to point to another issue
# Notice the issue history tracks this change
# Set the Team value
# Notice the issue history tracks this change
# Edit the issue and change another field such as priority, description, ...

h3. Expected Results
Issue history should only track the new change made

h3. Actual Results
Issue history logs the change to the field along with Team and Parent link and display unchanged values. 

h3. Notes
Along with recording a change for Parent Link, "issuelink_deleted" and "issuelink_created" events are fired because the issue link for the parent issue is indeed removed and recreated. This may needlessly cause automations to fire.
{noformat}
LOG:  execute <unnamed>: DELETE FROM public.issuelink WHERE ID=$1
DETAIL:  parameters: $1 = '10705'
...
LOG:  execute <unnamed>: INSERT INTO public.issuelink (ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE) VALUES ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5)
DETAIL:  parameters: $1 = '10706', $2 = '10300', $3 = '10501', $4 = '10800', $5 = NULL
{noformat}
fields.summary: Parent Link and Team fields are being audited in History even when they're not updated

fields.description:
Currently, the "Parent Link" field is NOT cleared for an issue when it is moved from hierarchy at Epic Level or above to Story level.

For example, the project hierarchy is Initiative -> Epic -> Story -> Sub-Task

I have an Epic with "Parent Link" set to an Initiative. At a later date, after backlog grooming, I move the Epic to a Story and set a Epic Link. The Parent Link is not available on UI now, even though the value is NOT cleared.

Now, when I remove the Epic Link I set, the Parent Link is displayed as shown below, which is incorrect. This incorrect setting of Parent Link is creating problems with the JQL queries we run and also the boards we have configured in our projects.

!image-2017-11-28-15-03-04-423.png!
fields.summary: Clear the value of "Parent Link" field when moving issue from above "Epic" Level to Issue Type below Epic Level

fields.description:
*Summary*

JIRA Portfolio Target Schedule report documentation describes the ability to group items by labels or components. This grouping option is not present in the menu.
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/target-schedule-report-868977986.html]

From the documentation:
{quote}
|Grouping|It allows you to optionally group work items by labels or components.|
{quote}
*Expected behavior:*
 Target Schedule report includes ability to group by labels or components. This is what is described in documentation.

*Actual Behavior:*
 Target Schedule report does not contain any option to group issues.
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-16 at 3.11.33 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Load Portfolio for Jira 2.8 in Jira
 2. Create plan with sample data
 3. Click on the Reports tab
 4. Select Target Schedule for Switch Report
 5. Click the gear icon

*Workaround:*

There is no known workaround

*Notes:*

We tested this on Portfolio 2.2, 2.2.2, 2.6.1 and 2.8 and all version exhibited the same behavior.
fields.summary: Target Schedule Report does not have the Grouping option

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching for teams (JQL), it's possible to match stories that are not currently assigned to the searched team. This happens because sub-task team comes from its parent but could technically be assigned to another team if it was converted to a sub-task.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 shared team T1 and T2,
# Create 2 stories S1 and S2
# Assign S1 to T1
# Assign S2 to T2
# Convert S2 to be a sub-task of S1

h3. Expected Results
The team of S2 is inherited from its parent task S1, thus changed to T1. 

h3. Actual Results
The team of S2 shows in the UI as T1. 
However, a JQL search with {{Team = "T1" AND Team = "T2"}} returns the issue S2. 
 
h3. Notes
* This problem can lead to subtasks appearing in two Portfolio boards/plans. 
* Converting S2 back to a task shows its team value is still set to T2. 
* The database value of the team for S2 (in the *entity_property* table) is not changed when converting it to a sub-task. 

h3.Workaround
# Convert S2 back to a task. 
# Change its team manually. 
# Convert S2 to a subtask of S1.
fields.summary: Team field is not properly set after converting an issue to a sub-task

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Create 2 issues A and B with estimation
 * Make A depend on B
 * Calculate
 ** *A is now scheduled after B as expected*
 * Turn off dependency scheduling in the plan configuration
 * Calculate
 ** *A is now scheduled first as expected (ignoring dependency)*
 * Set an earlier start date to B further in the futur
 * Calculate
 ** *Unexpected: A is now waiting for B to start before being scheduled*
 ** *Expected: A should start whenever possible regardless of its dependencies* (when dependencies scheduling is turned off)

 

While there might be some other ways to reproduce this, this is the clearest / shortest way.
fields.summary: Dependencies are still impacting scheduling when turned off

fields.description: In a program schedule, add a configuration to hide the schedule item for items without parent as it sometimes add confusion especially on reporting.
fields.summary: Allow to hide "Issues without ..." in program schedule

fields.description: Currently when the calculation of a Portfolio Program ends you are asked to reload the page to see the result. It would be nice to dynamically reload the data without reloading the page.

h3. Description

When looking at the Scope configuration in a Plan, there's currently no way to remove issues from Sprints. You you can only switch stories between existing sprints. There should be a way to remove issues from Sprints directly from within the Plan view.

h3. Work around

Current work around is to simple remove the sprint manually either through the Issue View or the Backlog.
fields.summary: Option for removing Sprints entirely from Scope view

JIRA Portfolio Target Schedule report documentation describes the ability to group items by labels or components. This grouping option is not present in the menu.
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/target-schedule-report-868977986.html]

From the documentation:
{quote}
|Grouping|It allows you to optionally group work items by labels or components.|
{quote}
*Expected behavior:*
 Target Schedule report includes ability to group by labels or components. This is what is described in documentation.

*Actual Behavior:*
 Target Schedule report does not contain any option to group issues.
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-16 at 3.11.33 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Load Portfolio for Jira 2.8 in Jira
 2. Create plan with sample data
 3. Click on the Reports tab
 4. Select Target Schedule for Switch Report
 5. Click the gear icon

*Workaround:*

There is no known workaround

*Notes:*

We tested this on Portfolio 2.2, 2.2.2, 2.6.1 and 2.8 and all version exhibited the same behavior.
fields.summary: Target Schedule Report does not have the Grouping option

fields.description:
As a product owner, I need to be able to account for variable velocity of my teams over time so that I can plan for holidays or global days off more easily.

Currently, you have to add team members and add absences for each team member to account for a holiday or a dip in available velocity for the team. And you can't modify the velocity for a team without modifying the velocity going forward. 

It would be very helpful if you could change the available velocity for given sprints in general, rather than having to modify or rely on team member absences. For example, for the Christmas holiday, that sprint will have 50% capacity, but the following sprint will have full, and then new years will have 50%. Or something along those lines. Being able to simply change the velocity at a sprint by sprint level as a sort of override would greatly simplify the process of having a variable velocity.

In the old experience, it was possible to view the velocity per sprint : !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h2. Suggestion

In the New view, we need :
 * A way to calculate and clearly see the previous sprints' velocity
 * A way to set the velocity for future sprints
fields.summary: Allow variable velocity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Portfolio doesn't have an integrity checker like Jira. This can be an issue for Plans which are based on filters that are no longer in existence in the instance. This could cause the plan to not open with a 500 error. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Integrity Checker to check if Plans have valid filters. Else remove this from the source of the plan.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker for Portfolio

fields.description: As a user of JIRA Portfolio, I would like the progress bar to included any items that is filtered out, so that I an get an accurate gauge on the current progress.  Specifically, I generally try to filter "Only Open Issues" as I don't want the completed items to clutter my view.  But when I do this, then all the progress is set to 0%, because all the done items are filtered out.  This is not ideal as I can't figure out how far along a parent item really is.
fields.summary: Progress Bar includes filtered out items

fields.description: User stories lasting longer than one 2-week sprint should be represented as a box spanning sprints, not as multiple boxes that are each contained within one sprint.
fields.summary: User Story "box" span multiple sprints in timeline

fields.description:
When we use JIRA Portfolio to plan (Top down for example for SAFe method), we create a plan with estimated EPIC but when we estimate STORIES, the EPIC's estimation aggregates its points and each STORY point.

If we use the "Set baseline" function when we receive the plan (only with EPIC's estimation), the Story points field is copied to Original Story Points field but Story points field isn't cleaned.
fields.summary: Do not aggregate Story Point on high level issue

fields.description: Allow to define the maximum number of assignees per issue calculated by Portfolio for hierarchies above the Story level.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Occasionally, edited skill distributions for an issue will continually revert to their defaults after committing the changes.
h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Theme with two skills and a non-default distribution (e.g 2:1);
 # Create an issue under the new theme with a non-zero estimation, and commit it to Jira;
 # Edit the skill distribution on the created issue (assign 100% of the estimate to one of the skills);
 # Commit the change.

h3. Expected Results

After the scope table refreshes, the issue has 100% of its estimation assigned to the skill.
h3. Actual Results

After the scope table refreshes, the skill distribution on the issue has reverted to its default starting values, and the edit has not been applied.
h3. Notes

This issue cannot be consistently reproduced in a clean instance (yet), but shows up sporadically under specific conditions.
fields.summary: Updated Skills distributions revert to defaults on commit

fields.description:
At the moment Portfolio assigns the whole team to each epic, assuming they will be completed one-by-one as a team. 

Whilst I can understand some of the reasons behind this, a lot of the time it's completely unrealistic. For example it may only be possible for 2 people to work on an epic at once, and the rest of the team can focus on a different initiative. Also putting a whole team of 5 developers onto an epic with a 10 day estimate and assuming this means it will be completed in 2 days is both wrong (it would probably take longer) and leads to a ridiculous looking roadmap.

A workaround is to assign specific team members to each epic. However this doesn't work particularly well as it restricts Portfolio's ability to move work around. What if you don't care who does the work, you just know you want to assign 2 developers to this, 3 to that etc.

 

At the moment it's possible to restrict the number of developers assigned per story. We would like a similar feature, but the ability to put a limit on the number of developers that can be assigned on a per epic basis.
fields.summary: Allow maximum assignees per epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira took a longer startup time with Portfolio installed. Portfolio appears to be taking time querying data from the database.

Problem is caused by slow methods: {{findTableNames}} and {{findColumnNames}}. Which used a metadata query known to cause performance problems in Oracle: {{metaData.getTables(null, null, null, null)}} and {{metaData.getColumns(null, null, null, null)}}.
See related: 
* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2068665/oracle-10g-slow-metadata-queries
* https://community.oracle.com/thread/105008?start=0&tstart=0

h3. Environment
* Portfolio installed
* Oracle database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Jira with Oracle
# Install Portfolio for JIRA
# Restart JIRA

h3. Expected Results
JIRA startup quickly

h3. Actual Results
Generating thread dumps when starting up JIRA show traces of the following on *localhost-startStop-* thread:

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

I believe that creating web services for Portfolio will be a great benefits to Organisations and all its users.  Lets take this as example:

I have a JIRA project containing a few fields created with Portfolio for JIRA.  Now, I would like to synchronise two JIRA instances.  Kindly note that both instances have Portfolio for JIRA installed.  

The problem I encountered is that there isn't a single add on the Atlassian Market that is capable of synchronising field created by/through Portfolio for JIRA and this is mainly due the fact that the JIRA REST API does not expose a web service for this particular add on, therefore this is leading a big project I have with a client to failure.

Your assistance will be greatly appreciated.

 

Regards

fields.description:
As a multi-disciplinary engineering group, we have always longed for a tool to both plan and execute from. Portfolio addresses many of the needs we and others have in this realm, but lacks features relevant for any type of work that requires delays (including external non-agile teams, ordering, shipping, lead times...).

It's currently near impossible to make portfolio truly work for this because it is missing a time delay feature for dependencies, or mixed fixed time & SP plans. Workarounds such as creating delay teams for specific tasks at set SP velocities quickly become far too complex to handle. 

If you would like to gain a huge customer base within hardware & mixed development groups *_ADD TIME DELAY DEPENDENCIES_!*

*Alternatively, allow fixed time items within SP Portfolio.* 

Examples:

JIRA-123 blocks JIRA-124 with 2 week delay

JIRA-124 is blocked by JIRA-123  +2 weeks

 

Very briefly alluded to in: JPOSERVER-1371
fields.summary: Create time delays links between issues, or mixed time & SP velocity plans.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When Creating Child Issues As detailed in:
 * [Creating and deleting issues |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/creating-and-deleting-issues-802170523.html]

On initial create of a child issue there is a Plus option " + " on the main issue in the scope view when no children issues exist:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-16 at 1.14.26 PM.png|thumbnail!

Once an issue is created under the parent issue or Epic and the set focus is moved away from the inline create option the {{" + "}} option is removed and moved to the Green plus and Line {{" + "}} between each child issue causing an inconsistent user interface and causes confusion on the follow up location for nested issue creation:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-16 at 1.15.59 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2017-10-16 at 1.17.39 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

While this option Offers a more flexible method for creating new issues with the appropriate Rank on follow up Child issue creation the behavior switch is not intuitive and it would be nice to leave the initial create child issue Plus icon "+" in place after a child issue exists for a consistent UI experience in addition to having the additional direct location create option.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Stackoverflow error can be triggered by selecting the Portfolio Drop Down Menu when there is a large user base AND system is under load

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Reproducable in Environment with ~2800 Groups Synced via LDAP to jira associated to single user (smaller group associations can trigger under system load)
# Select the Portfolio menu drop down as the user

h3. Expected Results
Menu drop down opens

h3. Actual Results
Stackoverflow exception is triggered and Extreme performance degradation or system crash occurs:
{noformat}
ERROR [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet [action] in context with path [] threw exception [Servlet execution threw an exception] with root cause
java.lang.StackOverflowError
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
If the user selecting the menu dropdown belongs to a sufficiently large number of groups (i.e.. 2800 groups in test performed under no system load), then QueryDslPermissionPersistence#getPermissionsFor will cause a StackOverflowError.

This is because we add an extra expression to the where-clause for each 'PermissionHolder'.
QueryDsl evaluate all the expressions recursively, and for a large enough list of expressions it will run out of stack space.

h3.Workaround
Restart JIRA OR reduce the number of groups associated to user accounts

fields.description:
h3.  *Update 6 Aug 2020:*

 This bug has been backported to Jira Core 8.5, will be available in the Jira 8.5.8 release.

 

 
{panel:title=  Update 17 Feb 2020:}
This bug is resolved by upgrading to Jira Core 8.8, relevant ticket: JRASERVER-70656
{panel}
 
h3. Summary

If we have default resolution set in JIRA, committing issues though live plans causes the new tickets created in the process to have a Resolution Date, though no Resolution.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Create a Portfolio plan and add the project as an issue source
 # Go to Resolutions page in JIRA (type g+g >> resolutions, under [https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewResolutions.jspa])
 # Select a resolution as default
 # Add an issue to the plan
 # Commit it so it's created in JIRA

h3. Expected Results

The ticket is created without Resolution Date, as it doesn't have a resolution.
h3. Actual Results

It's created with no Resolution (as expected), but with a Resolution Date (not expected):
 !resolution_problem.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workarounds
{panel}
h4. Workaround 1: no default resolution

Don't make use of default resolution until you can upgrade to a fixed version.
 Clearing the default resolution on the Resolutions admin page's blocked by JRASERVER-70041, so to clear it you may:
 # Create a new Resolution temporarily
 # Set this new Resolution to be default
 # Delete the new Resolution

h4. Workaround 2: tweak the workflows (suggested in comments below)
 # Change the 'Create' transition for this issue
 # Add a post-function to clear the 'resolution' (not resolution date)
 ** This should also clean the resolution date

h4. Workaround 3: create issues in Jira
 # Create issues directly through Jira, rather than Portfolio. This should avoid the problem.{panel}
fields.summary: Default Resolution causes issues to be committed with Resolution Date

fields.description:
h2. Summary

For some specific scenarios (orphaned sub-task items) Jira Portfolio blocks the update calls for affected items:
 * "Delete" (or any other like "Move" or "Convert") item ends up with an error:

{code:java}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.rm.teams.customfields.team.IssueTeamService.getTeamForNonSubTask(IssueTeamService.java:50) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.rm.teams.customfields.team.IssueTeamService.getTeam(IssueTeamService.java:35) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.rm.teams.customfields.team.TeamCustomFieldTypeHelper.getTeam(TeamCustomFieldTypeHelper.java:117) [?:?]
{code}
At the same time the JIRA lexorank engine is handling that issue with a warning only:
{code:java}
NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 WARN [greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintHistoryEntryFactory] Unable to fetch parent issue for RMBRITS-317
{code}
h2. Environment
 * JIRA Software: 7.2.10
 * Portfolio for JIRA: 2.6.1

h2. Steps to Reproduce

There's no easy step to reproduce. The orphaned sub-task item is required (that may be related to unidentified JIRA bug).
h2. Expected Results

"Delete" action should be successful (even with a warning).
h2. Actual Results

Any UI update is failing with NPE for the specific item.
h2. Workaround
 * This issue could not be reproduced locally. 
 * The customers could execute the [Jira database integrity checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-the-database-integrity-checker-938847667.html].
 * Focus on the first section named "Check Issue Relations".
If it finds any errors, choose to fix them. You can refer to the article (+)[Sub-tasks are not Correctly Associated with Parent Issues in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/sub-tasks-are-not-correctly-associated-with-parent-issues-in-task-board-779158743.html#Sub-tasksarenotCorrectlyAssociatedwithParentIssuesinJira-Solution]
 * Then try to run the re-indexing and see if the issue is resolved.

h3. *Quick fix :* 

This issue could be solved by running the "integrity checker".
h4. Trouble shooting : 

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshoot-a-reindex-failure-in-jira-server-429917142.html]
fields.summary: NullPointerException in loading data due to orphaned sub-task items issue

fields.description:
Scenario:
 # Setup team of four members with velocity of 40 points
 # Mark one member as becoming unavailable at end of sprint (e.g. set 'End date' on global availability)
 # Add a new team member that becomes available at start of the next sprint (e.g. set 'Start date' on global availability)

 

Expected behaviour:
 # At no point will there be more than 4 members available on the team
 # Person capacity should be 10 (e.g. 40 points divided by 4 members)

 

Current behaviour (see attached [^Wrong Person Capacity.png]):
 # Capacity report correctly indicate that only 4 members are available at any given time.
 # Person capacity incorrectly indicates 8 (e.g. 40 points divided by 5 members).
fields.summary: Person capacity calculation should consider availability
